sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you see a <radical>spirit</radical> with an <radical>axe</radical>, you better <kanji>pray</kanji> for your life. Spirits only hold axes if they're thinking about murder, so pray as hard as you can to try and get it to spare you.
meaningInfo: Imagine trying to pray as hard as you can as a spirit with an axe closes in on you. Can you hold your prayer concentration long enough?
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>pray</kanji> and pray and pray and nothing happens. You stop praying and dare to open your eyes. There is a <reading>key</reading> (<ja>き</ja>) in front of you. Grab the key and hold it before you and pray for the spirit to take it. Moments later, both the key and the spirit are gone.
readingInfo: I guess the key was prayer all along. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
